text: Commander Claude Edward Lutley Sclater DSO and bar, FRGS, MA (b. 24 January 1910, Odiham, Hampshire - d. 20h April 1986), was a British naval officer and, in later life, academic. Sclater saw much action in World War II, mainly in destroyers, in several notable actions (Dunkirk evacuation and Scharnhorst sinking) and being decorated with the Distinguished Service Order and bar. After his retirement from the Navy, he was a senior member of the management staff at King's College, Cambridge. ==References== * COMMANDER CLAUDE SCLATER DSO and bar, FRGS, MA] Category:People from Odiham Category:People educated at Twyford School Category:Graduates of Britannia Royal Naval College Category:Companions of the Distinguished Service Order Category:Officers of the Order of the Crown (Belgium) Category:Fellows of the Royal Geographical Society Category:1910 births Category:1986 deaths
title: Claude Sclater
